page.title: 03WILDLIFE
page.content: WILDLIFE IN STAUNTON ON WYE 1 Flowers: profusion of wildflowers includes cowslips and pasque flowers now on the increase. 2 Birds: All usual species plus lesser spotted woodpecker, redstart, kingfisher, red kite, owls, buzzards, kestrels and sparrowhawks. The water fowl include Canada geese which breed here. 3 Animals: All the usual resident forms are found incluing hares, toads, and pipistrelle bats. Foxes are numerous and there are more squirrels this year. Mink are increasingly seen replacing the otter and there are badgers. 4 Insects: Butterflies are not so numerous but include common brimstone, painted lady and clouded yellow. .
